properties.description: Grade II-listed Georgian domestic building c.1760, formerly part of Bedford Estate. Interior refurbished 1924-5 to form lecture hall (restored 2014), library, bookshop and offices. Oak woodwork and green Doulton tiles line the staircase.
properties.name: The Swedenborg Society

properties.description: Grade I Victorian Gothic church by G E Street, architect of the Royal Courts of Justice. The recent conservation project reveals the majestic colours of Daniel Bell's painted ceiling, plus Dow Jones Architects' contemporary heritage wing.
properties.name: Grand Junction at St Mary Magdalene Church, Paddington

properties.description: Founded in 11C, with Jacobean memorial c1615. Burial site of 5 Archbishops of Canterbury.
properties.name: Church of St Mary the Blessed Virgin

properties.description: Founded by William the Conqueror's Archbishop Lanfranc in 1080 (the significant crypt survives) St Mary-le-Bow was rebuilt, notably by Wren after the Great Fire and by Laurence King in 1964 after WWII destruction. Home of Bow Bells.
properties.name: The City Churches: St Mary-le-Bow

properties.description: London's main tourist information centre is clad in a specially manufactured system of 220 pre-finished stainless steel panels. The subtly reflective surface provides a striking counterpoint to St Paul's.
properties.name: City Information Centre

properties.description: Loughborough Pearson's red brick building is unimposing from the outside, but inside is a riot of Gothic Revival design. Golden mosaics reveal the character of the Grade II* listed chapel, built as part of the Middlesex Hospital.
properties.name: Fitzrovia Chapel

properties.description: This ambitious transformation of the former Camden Town Hall Annexe, a 1974 Brutalist structure, into a landmark hotel was achieved through the restoration of the original concrete fa√ßade and the addition of three striking storeys.
properties.name: The Standard, London

properties.description: Our timber frame building was designed by Matrix Feminist Design Co-Operative, and built by women. It represents our community's history of activism-the same ethos that transformed our site from dereliction, into a thriving community garden
properties.name: Walworth Garden

properties.description: Our 1950's warehouse has been converted to provide a new home for creative studio Acrylicize, to provide a mixture of workshop spaces, co-working and traditional studio space, all centred around a large events and gallery space.
properties.name: The Art House

properties.description:
A plain Victorian Church set in a wooded Churchyard, with a vibrant and striking set of Murals around the altar and the Choir. 
Has indoor toilet facilities. 
A good quality well used organ in good condition, and an excellent accoustic
properties.name: St Mary's Church Bromley

properties.description: Poroban is a multi-disciplinary design studio, based off Old Kent Road, specialising in low carbon building design. We are offering free design surgeries throughout September and are hosting an open day on Saturday 9th Sept.
properties.name: Poroban studio

properties.description: Newham Bookshop has been running for 45 years; it was founded in 1978. The bookshop plays an important role in this community, providing students, teachers, parents and the whole community with a rich variety of books.
properties.name: A bookshop for All

properties.description: A floating roof of sound, GPS-triggered & accessed by headphones & Echoes app to playfully reframe public space as an essential community engagement. One of 15 in an international series drawing on Oskar & Zofia Hansen‚Äôs Open Form concept.
properties.name: London Open Form Pavilion of Air

properties.description: Founded in 1840, our church began as a major force for good in the local area. We are still operating as a Church today where it was nicknamed 'The Devil‚Äôs Acre‚Äô by Charles Dickens due to great poverty and oppression.
properties.name: Westminster Chapel

properties.description: This tour will explore a working class view of Bloomsbury through the stories, famous names and classic British films associated with the neighbourhood over the past 60 years, with a special focus on theatrical, film and television personalities.
properties.name: Working class spaces of Bloomsbury

properties.description: This is a newly built and fitted out architecture studio in London Fields. We designed it as a flexible working and event space with the opportunity to align personal wellbeing and professional endeavour in one supportive space.
properties.name: AH A Studio

properties.description:
Yorkton Workshops is a newly remodeled building that merges Victorian features with modern industrial details.
House to the design firm Pearson Lloyd.
We are thrilled to show you what we do and where we do it.
properties.name: Yorkton Workshop

properties.description: Guided walking tours of the grounds of Bethlem Royal Hospital, taking in the Hospital's historic Chapel, its beautiful grounds, Bethlem Museum of the Mind, and Bethlem Gallery. Open House 2023 tours delivered as part of This is Croydon, London Borough of Culture, with the support of Mayor of London and Croydon Council.
properties.name: Bethlem Royal Hospital

properties.description: Art Deco building designed in 1934 by Leslie Kemp and Tasker in International Moderne style. Now the temporary home of West Wickham Library.
properties.name: West Wickham Library
